title: Building Lemma Chains
content:
Overview

Complex inequalities or identities often fall after assembling a chain of small lemmas (e.g., smoothing, convexity, or Muirhead).

Strategy

Prove helper bounds (e.g., a^3+b^3+c^3+3abc \ge \sum_{sym} a^2b) and reuse them modularly.

Solution Sketch

Apply Cauchy in Engel form, then use \sum \frac{a^2}{a+b} \ge \frac{(a+b+c)^2}{2(a+b+c)}=\frac{a+b+c}{2} after expansions.
